intro: Zappania reptans, commonly known as the creeping zappania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with slender stems that root at the nodes. Its small, white to pink flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom during the wet season. Zappania reptans is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices.
